programme.title: Vincent Price: Master of the Silver Scream
programme.desc: From 'Haunted Hill' to Corman classics, Vincent Price sent shivers down the spines of horror fans for decades.

programme.title: Stephen King Stories and Decoding David Lynch
programme.desc: From Carrie to Eraserhead and beyond, Stephen King and David Lynch have defined cinematic storytelling for decades.

programme.title: Joe Dante’s Noir Nightmares
programme.desc: TFH creator Joe Dante celebrates the noir classics that explore themes of identity, paranoia, and duality.

programme.title: Terror Titans: The Films of Wes Craven and John Carpenter
programme.desc: Two masters of horror bring your nightmares to the big screen in this spine-chilling collection.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.sub-title: Big Hair and Big Scares Vol. 1
programme.desc: Hop in the DeLorean and return to the 80s, when slashers ruled the box office.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.sub-title: Big Hair and Big Scares Vol. 2
programme.desc: The nightmare continues with 80s hits and cult classics with Cronenberg, Cujo, and more!

programme.title: The Astral Factor
programme.desc: A convicted killer learns how to become invisible and breaks free from prison. Now, he’s on the loose and out for revenge against the women that sent him to prison.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.sub-title: Demons, Devils, Chainsaws and Zombies Vol. 1
programme.desc: In a “Deep Red” part of the country, “The Texas Chainsaw Massacre” made all of us squirm like “Three On A Meathook.”

programme.title: Dementia 13
programme.desc: Shocked by the death of her spouse, a scheming widow hatches a bold plan to get her hands on the inheritance, unaware that she is targeted by an axe-wielding murderer who lurks in the family's estate. What mystery shrouds the noble house?

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.sub-title: Demons, Devils, Chainsaws and Zombies Vol. 2
programme.desc: The nightmare never ends as your favorite filmmakers talk iconic horror movies.

programme.title: Carnival of Souls
programme.desc: A young woman tries to escape her traumatic past, only to find herself haunted by a ghoulish mystery man from an abandoned carnival pavilion.

programme.title: Monsters, Monsters Everywhere!
programme.desc: Mutated beasts, creepy crawlies, and more movie monsters are coming to get you!

programme.title: White Zombie
programme.desc: A young man turns to a witch doctor to lure the woman he loves away from her fiancé, but instead turns her into a zombie slave.

programme.title: Bela Lugosi Beyond Dracula
programme.desc: From monster mashups and horror hijinks, Bela Lugosi was much more than cinema’s greatest vampire.

programme.title: Karloff: The King of Horror
programme.desc: Boris Karloff's portrayal of monsters and villains made him the undisputed king of 20th century horror.

programme.title: Monsters & Misfits: The Legacy of Lon Chaney Jr.
programme.desc: Celebrate Lon Chaney Jr.’s big screen legacy of classic creatures and complex misfits.

programme.title: Mad, Mad, Mad Scientists Vol. 1: Monstrous Minds
programme.desc: Enter the minds of the twisted geniuses who gave birth to monstrous creations and big screen horrors.

programme.title: Mad, Mad, Mad Scientists Vol. 2: The Perils of Playing God
programme.desc: Explore the dark side of scientific ambition, where unhinged minds push the boundaries of big screen horror.

programme.title: Mad, Mad, Mad Scientists Vol. 3: Experiments Gone Awry
programme.desc: Reckless experiments lead to monstrous results in these horrific Hollywood cult hits.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: It was a “Night Of The Living Dead” that “I Walked With A Zombie” to finally meet “Rosemary’s Baby.”

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: It was an eerie night of "Dark Shadows” when I caught the “Brain Dead,” "Cemetery Man” looking just like a “Zombie.” He was caught “Burying The Ex” for her life insurance policy.

programme.title: House on Haunted Hill
programme.desc: Vincent Price is throwing a party, and he’s invited five strangers with the promise of $10,000 each, if they can survive the night in the House on Haunted Hill. Director William Castle helmed this 1959 horror hit, which famously utilized the “Emergo” theatrical gimmick to spook moviegoers out of their seats.

programme.desc: Werewolves and “Cat People” take over your screen and your nightmares!

programme.desc: Witness the greatest slashers in cinema history, from Crystal Lake to Elm Street to the Bates Motel and more.

programme.title: Remembering Romero

programme.desc: From “Nosferatu” to “Dracula,” everyone loves blood-sucking Vampires!

programme.desc: From Norman Bates to Michael Myers and more, these killers love carving up the screen.

programme.desc: A disgraced museum employee schemes to take advantage of a trusting invalid.
